Mr. Holland's Opus 1995. Hollywood. $103.92. Laser disk, $39.99. 143 minutes. Closed captioned. PG.

I made 32 kids sleep with their eyes open," says Glenn Holland (Richard Dreyfuss) at the outset of a 30-year career as a high school music teacher. Glenn would prefer a career as a composer, but after some downsizing of aspirations, he proceeds to make his music appreciation class one of the most popular courses and himself something of a revered figure. More remarkably perhaps, Mr. Dreyfuss modulates his renowned penchant for histrionics to give a controlled performance in a film that is, Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times, "disarming in easy, predictable ways that are just about impossible to resist."
